Title: AN ACT AMENDING ACT NUMBERED ELEVEN HUNDRED AND FORTY-SEVEN, ENTITLED "AN ACT REGULATING THE REGISTRATION, BRANDING, CONVEYANCE; AND SLAUGHTER OF LARGE CATTLE, AND PROVIDING FOR THE DISPOSITION, CARE, CUSTODY, AND SALE OF ESTRAYS OR LARGE CATTLE CAPTURED OR SEIZED BY THE PHILIPPINES CONSTABULARY OR OTHER PEACE OFFICERS, AND SO FORTH."
Data:
[ Act No. 2216, February 03, 1913 ]
AN ACT AMENDING ACT NUMBERED ELEVEN HUNDRED AND FORTY-SEVEN, ENTITLED "AN ACT REGULATING THE REGISTRATION, BRANDING, CONVEYANCE; AND SLAUGHTER OF LARGE CATTLE, AND PROVIDING FOR THE DISPOSITION, CARE, CUSTODY, AND SALE OF ESTRAYS OR LARGE CATTLE CAPTURED OR SEIZED BY THE PHILIPPINES CONSTABULARY OR OTHER PEACE OFFICERS, AND SO FORTH."
By authority of the United States, be it enacted by the Philippine Legislature, that:
Section 1.(aw√ûhi( Section thirteen of Act Numbered Eleven hundred and forty-seven, entitled "An Act regulating the registration, branding, conveyance, and slaughter of large cattle, and providing for the disposition, care, custody, and sale of estrays or large cattle captured or seized by the Philippines Constabulary or other peace officers, and so forth," is hereby amended to read as follows:
"Section 13. The municipal treasurer shall enter in a book, duly prepared and kept for the purpose, all transfers of large cattle, which entry shall set forth the name and residence of the owner, the name and residence of the purchaser, the purchase price of the animal or the consideration for the sale or transfer, the class, sex, age, brands, knots of radiated hair commonly known as remolinos or cowlicks, and other marks of identification of the animal, and a reference by number to the original certificate of ownership, with the name of the municipality which issued it.
Section 2. This Act shall take effect on its passage.
Enacted, February 3, 1913.
